{"step_by_step_thinking": "Collagen is a structural protein found in the skin and connective tissue. Hyaluronic acid binding protein is involved in cell adhesion and migration. Fibrinogen is a blood-clotting protein. Histones, on the other hand, are highly alkaline proteins found in eukaryotic cell nuclei that package and order the DNA into structural units called nucleosomes. They are rich in the amino acids arginine and lysine, which are basic amino acids.", "answer_choice": "A. Histone"}
